metadata.title: Georgia Strait - Production and Flux Observations, 1995-1999
metadata.description: Observations of physical, biological, sedimentation and chemical parameters in Georgia Strait, 1995-1999.
keywords: South Inner Coast (Johnstone, Georgia, JDF, inlets and passages)
metadata.notes:
Purpose: Seasonal cycles of particulate flux out of surface waters, primary production; physical and chemical properties of Haro Strait and Juan de Fuca Strait; nutrient supply/export mechanisms; Euphausiid distribution and stock assessment.

Supplemental Information: Risk Justification: Data are in electronic format, well backed up and well documented.
Risk of Loss: Low
Impact Justification: Time series of 5 to 10 years
Impact of Loss: Medium
Recommended Action: None
Additional Info: Other researchers collaborated in these cruises: Coring in the Strait of Georgia for tracer and contaminant concentrations (R. Macdonald, MEHS, IOS), Tests of CTD-turbulence probe (A. Gargett, OSAP, IOS). The isotope ratios were determined at UBC.

Status: Complete

Maintenance frequency: None planned

Access constraints: May Be Private

Use constraints: Juan de Fuca-Haro chemical data are private--not quality checked, not published. Sediment trap/ CTD /GS data are departmentally accessible after proprietary period.

Distribution liability: [unknown]

FGDC metadata date: 20080206

FGDC metadata standard: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata

FGDC metadata version: FGDC-STD-1998-1

Native data set environment: Expected Growth Rate: N/A

Data quality - Logical consistency: Normal calibration of CTD instruments at IOS, calibration of nutrient analyzer with commercial standards, standard seawater (salinity), calibration of fluorometer with commercial standards,
Data quality - Completeness: Dataset Complications: The accuracy of the CTD data may vary depending on the instruments used and whether collaborating data were collected for intercomparison purposes.  Guildline CTDs are standardized at IOS; Sea-Bird CTD`s are calibrated at Sea-Bird Electronics in Bellevue, Washington.
Electronic Data Complications: Null
Lineage - Process steps:
  1. Collaborative data with IOS, UBC and PBS

Distribution liability: [unknown]
Non-digital ordering: Hardcopy Original Exists: Y
Hardcopy Locations: Joseph Linguanti, Rm 1246 (cruise logs),  Mary O`Brien, Rm 2429 IOS(sediment traps)
Hardcopy Description: Cruise logs, data sheets and cruise reports (J. Linguanti);  sediment trap data sheets (M. O`Brien).
Fees: Ask Custodian

Geographic Areas: Strait of Georgia, Juan de Fuca Strait, and Haro Strait
